intro: Sphalmanthus gydouwensis, commonly known as the Gondwana burr, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces yellow or orange flowers during the warmer months. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
